taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section flagellares;species particularis;

treatment.description: Relatively coarse, the strongly armed canes up to 5 mm. thick and bearing stout straight prickles up to 3 or 4 mm. long; leaves soft-pilose beneath; primocane-leaves 5-foliolate, with densely villous petiole and petiolules; the median leaflets on elongate petiolules, elliptic-ovate, these and the broadly elliptic terminal one abruptly caudate-acuminate; stipules narrowly linear, 1-1.5 cm. long; floricane with densely villous flowering shoots, their leaflets oblong to narrowly elliptic-obovate; flowers 1 or 2 on erect strongly pubescent pedicels only 1-1.5 cm. long in anthesis.
